body_html:
Maybe try a different directory as your virtualenv dir i.e.

virtualenv --system-site-packages ~/foo

maybe you have some already existing tensorflow dir that is conflicting. However, this error has nothing to do with tensorflow yet. It means you don't have a working python installation which is a prerequisite for using tensorflow but not something we supprot or have control over. Good luck!

virtualenv --system-site-packages ~/foo

body:
Maybe try a different directory as your virtualenv dir i.e.
```
virtualenv --system-site-packages ~/foo
```
maybe you have some already existing tensorflow dir that is conflicting. However, this error has nothing to do with tensorflow yet. It means you don't have a working python installation which is a prerequisite for using tensorflow but not something we supprot or have control over. Good luck!
